body: @mvdan whilst I can see the motivation to discard it due to the maintanence burdon, the one obvious thing I'd miss, having enjoyed it for a while, is the std import coalescing (from https://github.com/mvdan/gofumpt/issues/8) as https://github.com/golang/go/issues/20818 hasn't had any movement.

Oh, that would remain as part of gofumpt, just like it exists there today. All the extra rules we have apply to both tools equally, minus enforcing of the simplify `-s` flag, since that's missing from `goimports`.
TIL â€” I thought I only had that because I was running gofumports on save :)
I personally never use gofumports. It's only useful if you want both gofumpt and goimports at once, and can't run both tools separately. It's a pretty weird edge case :)

issue.title: Add a `gofumports` as a new linter
issue.body:
`gofumpt` also has `gofumports`. Any way we can sneak that in here?

_Originally posted by @andrewrynhard in https://github.com/golangci/golangci-lint/pull/1239#issuecomment-657578408_

issue.title: gofumports extra option
issue.body:
gofumports does not support extra options.

```
$ gofumports --help
usage: gofumports [flags] [path ...]
  -cpuprofile string
        CPU profile output
  -d    display diffs instead of rewriting files
  -e    report all errors (not just the first 10 on different lines)
  -format-only
        if true, don't fix imports and only format. In this mode, gofumports is effectively gofmt, with the addition that imports are grouped into sections.
  -l    list files whose formatting differs from goimport's
  -lang string
        target Go version in the form 1.X (default from go.mod)
  -local string
        put imports beginning with this string after 3rd-party packages; comma-separated list
  -memprofile string
        memory profile output
  -memrate int
        if > 0, sets runtime.MemProfileRate
  -srcdir dir
        choose imports as if source code is from dir. When operating on a single file, dir may instead be the complete file name.
  -trace string
        trace profile output
  -v    verbose logging
  -w    write result to (source) file instead of stdout
```

issue.title: `goimports` functionality
issue.body: Currently using `goimports`. Would prefer `gofumpt` for stricter fmting, but the lack of automatic import editing is a show-stopper. Any chance this could be integrated?
